rooms.name: Entrance Hallway
rooms.description: A spacious and minimalist entrance hall with a large glass façade to maximize natural light, adhering to Vastu principles by facing the east for positive energy.

rooms.name: Open Living Area
rooms.description: A multifunctional space combining living, dining, and kitchen areas. Designed with open-plan layout to facilitate natural ventilation and ample daylight.

rooms.name: Kitchen
rooms.description: A compact but efficient kitchen with stainless steel fixtures, designed for a tight budget while ensuring ease of movement and natural lighting through skylights.

rooms.name: Home Theater
rooms.description: A dedicated home theater space integrated within the living area on the ground floor. Uses soundproof panels and optimized lighting for a cinematic experience.

rooms.name: Balcony (Bedroom Access)
rooms.description: A spacious balcony adjacent to the bedroom, designed for relaxation and enhanced natural ventilation. Incorporates minimalistic outdoor furniture.

openings.description: Large glass doors at the entrance to enhance natural light and improve ventilation, following Vastu guidelines for positive energy flow.
Strategically placed windows on the east side of the living area to maximize morning sunlight and adhere to Vastu principles.
A sliding door connecting the bedroom and balcony, ensuring easy access for ventilation and relaxation spaces.
A skylight above the kitchen area to supplement natural light during cloudy days and improve energy efficiency.

rooms.name: Master Bedroom
rooms.description: A spacious bedroom designed to maximize natural light through large windows on the east façade, with a dedicated balcony ensuring privacy and ventilation. Incorporates minimalist Brutalist elements.

rooms.name: Bedroom Balcony
rooms.description: An elongated balcony attached to the master bedroom, designed as a private outdoor space for relaxation and additional ventilation.

openings.description: Large windows in the master bedroom designed to follow Vastu principles by maximizing morning light and ensuring proper ventilation.
Sliding door connecting the master bedroom with its balcony to promote airflow and ease of access.

additional_info.budget_considerations: Design utilizes cost-effective materials like concrete, glass, and metal to adhere to a tight budget while preserving Brutalist aesthetics.
